definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: To give your enthusiasm a push in the right direction, refer to your notebook when the spiral is collapsing in on itself.
sentences.chinese: 當熱忱的螺旋轉錯方向時，不妨回顧一下你的記事簿。

sentences.english: For example, the editor uses a notebook and tabs.
sentences.chinese: 例如，編輯器使用一個記事簿和選項卡。

sentences.english: Ben picked up a notebook and started towrite Felicity a note.
sentences.chinese: 本拿起記事簿，開始給費莉希蒂寫紙條。

sentences.english: He wrote down a telephone number on a memo pad.
sentences.chinese: 他在記事簿上寫下了一個電話號碼。

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
